metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3077 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel Intelâ€™s iSMT SMBus host controller driver in the way it handled the I2C_SMBUS_BLOCK_PROC_CALL case (via the ioctl I2C_SMBUS) with malicious input data. This flaw could allow a local user to crash the system.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3077` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-aws - 5.15.0-1019.23~20.04.1
No subscription required
